content: I would like to slice a Coding element to indicate the preferred use of certain codes for certain scenarios. This is similar to what the is done with the slicing directly on Condition.code in the IPS Condition profile. However, as I understood from this long discussion, slicing of non-repeating, non-polymorphic fields like Condition.code will not be (generally) supported, so I am trying use slicing directly on CodeableConcept.Coding instead. The slices I want are defined by single codes, but from different code systems. I thought this might work with pattern-slicing but there I am forced to pick out a single element inside Coding (at least Forge wants me to do that) so I cannot provide a pattern involving both system and code. I suppose I could also bind each slice to a different single-code ValueSet & discriminate on that, though that somehow seems a little heavy-handed. Would that be the recommended approach or is there another way to achieve this?
Forge doesn’t offer you „$this“ when selecting the discriminator in the drop-down box. However, you can simply enter it directly. Then on each slice you can add a pattern with code and system.
@Rob Langezaal FYI, sounds like a small but good improvement to offer this directly
@Alexander Zautke I thought I tried that and it still generated an error, but seeing you answer I tried again and it works :smile:
And yes, would be nice to have this directly in Forge.
Morten Ernebjerg has marked this topic as resolved.
Note that you can't slice by value set unless you're using a 'required' binding. If you're slicing by system, that's fine.
